planets.name: Earth
planets.description: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only astronomical object known to harbor life.

planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun and has extreme temperature variations between day and night.

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: Venus is often called Earth's 'sister planet' due to its similar size and is known for its thick, toxic atmosphere.

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and often called the 'Red Planet' due to its reddish appearance.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system, known for its massive size and the Great Red Spot.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: Saturn is famous for its stunning ring system, composed of countless icy particles and rock.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: Uranus is a gas giant with a distinct blue-green color and rotates on its side.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: Neptune is the eighth planet and one of the gas giants, known for its deep blue color and strong winds.
